lines.content: The simple guide to using Duke, by Aldo Maximillian
The user is able to add tasks
The user is able to delete tasks
The user is able to search for tasks
The user is able to mark individual tasks as done
Todo is a command to add a task. Todo is a plain task with only a task name.
Got it. I've added this task
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Event is a command to add an event to the task lst. Event is a task with a set time.
Got it. I've added this task
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Deadline is a command to add a deadline. Deadline is a task a set deadline.
`deadline do CS2113T iP coding /by Friday 2 Oct`
Got it. I've added this task
[D][✗] do cs2113t ip coding (by: friday 2 oct)
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
This command will list all the task in the task list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
3. [D][✗] do cs2113t ip coding (by: friday 2 oct)
This command will set the task according to the task index to done.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
This command will delete the task according to the task index.
Got it. I've deleted this task
Now you have 2 tasks in the list
This command will delete the task according to the task index.
Here is what I found for "clean"
This command will show the help message for the user
1. Todo - Task with only the description
2. Deadline - Task with a set deadline
3. Event - Task with a set date
D. MARK THE TASK AS DONE
This command will end the program
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
* Executes the command given by the user.
* The function parses the function and executes command according to the task
* @param taskList  takes in the taskList class and perform operations based on the taskList
* @param ui handles the input and output from and to the user.
* @param storage handles the File output to save the updated taskList after the command.
* @throws DukeException if there are invalid command structures.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
// Parses the command with whitespace as the regex
// Command phrase is the first phrase of the command, it denotes the command type
// To differentiate a one worded command to a multi-worded command.
// If statement to discern the commands given by the user
throw new InvalidCommandException("Invalid Command. \n\tType help to show the help screen");
// Check the status of the isExit variable.
* The method will create a directory, if it doesnt exist
* The method will also create a file, if it doesnt exist
* @param filePath is the path in which the file exist
//Creates the file and the directory if it doesnt exist
* Loads the task from the file
* @return returns a taskList class loaded from the task.txt file.
* Processes the file by separating the tasks line by line.
* Categorizes the tasks into Deadline, Event, and Todo
* Creates each of the object and adding it into the loadedTask class.
* @param taskData is a line of String that contains the data of the tasks.
* @param loadedTask is a TaskList object that will load the tasks from the file.
private void loadTask(String taskData, TaskList loadedTask) {
//loads the new task into the task.
* Writes the tasks into the file
* @param taskList is a TaskList which contains the tasks to be saved to the file.
private static ArrayList<Task> userTasks  = new ArrayList<>();
* @param load gets the TaskList from the Storage class
* Adds a task into the taskList
* @param task the task to add to the taskList
* deletes a task from the taskList with the taskIndex as the input.
* @param taskIndex the index of the task to be deleted.
* Gets a task from the taskList
* @param taskIndex task index is the input to get the task from the taskList
* @return task returns a Task from the taskList
* Gets the size of the taskList
* @return int the size of the taskList
* gets the search result from the taskList class
* @param searchPhrase is a String that contains the search keyword
* @return returns a String that contains all the task from the search
* Initializes the Ui by creating the Scanner instance.
// Reads the line and returns the string of the command given by the user.
// Prints the welcome message when the user executes the program
System.out.println("\tWhat can I do for you?");
// Prints bye message after the user exits the program
System.out.println("\tBye. Hope to see you again soon!");
// Prints the done message to acknowledge a task to be turned to done
System.out.println("\tNice! I've marked this task as done: \n\t\t" + GREEN_TEXT + task.toString() + RESET_TEXT);
// Prints the help message that shows how to properly type commands //
System.out.println("\t1. Todo - Task with only the description\n\t\ttodo <task description>");
System.out.println("\t2. Deadline - Task with a set deadline \n\t\tdeadline <task description> /by <date of completion>");
System.out.println("\t3. Event - Task with a set date\n\t\tevent <task description> /at <date of event>");
System.out.println("D. MARK THE TASK AS DONE");
// Print the acknowledge message after adding a task.
public void printAcknowledgeMessage(Task task, int taskListSize) {
System.out.println("\tGot it. I've added this task");
System.out.println("\tNow you have " + taskListSize + " tasks in the list.");
// Print the acknowledge message after adding a task.
public void printDeleteAcknowledgeMessage(Task task, int taskListSize) {
System.out.println("\tGot it. I've deleted this task");
System.out.println("\tNow you have " + taskListSize + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints all of the task in the task list.
* If there is no task on the list, it will notify that the list is empty
System.out.println("\tHere are the tasks in your list:");
// Prints an error message of the command detail exceeds the task number.
System.out.println(RED_TEXT + "\tThe number exceeds the task number" + RESET_TEXT);
// Prints an error message if there is not task in the taskList.
System.out.println(RED_TEXT + "\t\tThere is no task in the list" + RESET_TEXT);
// Prints an error message if the user inputs a string to the done or delete command
// Prints an error message if the Event or Deadline command is incomplete
System.out.println(RED_TEXT + "\tPlease enter a valid task or deadline format" + RESET_TEXT);
System.out.println("\tDeadline - Task with a set deadline \n\t\tdeadline <task description> /by <date of completion>");
System.out.println("\tEvent - Task with a set date\n\t\tevent <task description> /at <date of event>");
* Prints the search result from the searchResult variable
* @param searchResult is the String that contains the search result
public void printSearchResult(String searchResult, String searchPhrase){
System.out.print("\tHere is what I found for \""+ searchPhrase +"\"\n\t\t");
System.out.println(RED_TEXT + "I'm sorry, I cannot find \"" + searchPhrase +"\" in the list" + RESET_TEXT);
* Prints the error message to the console.
